00040 #ifndef _actorgraphicssettings_h
00041 #define _actorgraphicssettings_h
00042 
00043 #include "datatypes.h"
00044 #include "colourvalue.h"
00045 
00046 namespace Ogre
00047 {
00048     class Entity;
00049     class MaterialPtr;
00050 }
00051 
00052 namespace phys
00053 {
00054     class ActorBase;
00055     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00056     /// @class ActorGraphicsSettings
00057     /// @headerfile actorgraphicssettings.h
00058     /// @brief This is a helper class for configuring graphics settings of an actor.
00059     /// @details This class contains functions for the configuring of graphics specific settings of an actor.
00060     /// This class can only configure the actors graphics.  For configuring actor physics, see ActorPhysicsSettings.
00061     ///////////////////////////////////////
00062     class ActorGraphicsSettings
00063     {
00064         protected:
00065             /// @internal
00066             /// @brief Store meta data for actor
00067             Ogre::Entity* ActorEnt;
00068             /// @brief The Actor this bleongs to
00069             ActorBase* Parent;
00070             //@internal
00071             /// @brief Material/textures for the actor
00072             Ogre::MaterialPtr GetMaterial(Whole Submesh = 0);
00073         public:
00074             /// @brief Standard Constructor.
00075             /// @param Actor The actor this settings class configures.
00076             /// @param GraphicsObject The graphics object belonging to the actor this class configures.
00077             ActorGraphicsSettings(ActorBase* Actor, Ogre::Entity* GraphicsObject);
00078             /// @brief Class destructor.
00079             ~ActorGraphicsSettings();
00080             /// @brief Sets the material of the specified submesh.
00081             /// @details The name of the material isn't the same as the name of the .material file.
00082             /// As a single material file can contain several material scripts.  The name this function
00083             /// expects is the name of the material script inside a .material file.
00084             /// @param MatName The name of the material to be applied.
00085             /// @param Submesh The submesh to apply the material to.
00086             void SetMaterial(String MatName, Whole Submesh = 0);
00087             /// @brief Gets the material name of the specified submesh.
00088             /// @details Note the returned name isn't of the .material file, but the material script.
00089             /// @param Submesh The submesh you want to get the material name from.
00090             /// @return Returns a String containing the name of the material script in use.
00091             ConstString& GetMaterialName(Whole Submesh = 0);
00092             /// @brief Gets whether or not the specified submesh has a material script assigned to it.
00093             /// @param Submesh The submesh to check.
00094             /// @return Returns a bool indicating whether there is a material assigned to the specified submesh.
00095             bool HasMaterialSet(Whole Submesh = 0);
00096             /// @brief Gets the number of submeshes in the mesh of the graphics ohject.
00097             /// @return Returns a whole representing the number of submeshes in this objects mesh.
00098             Whole GetNumSubmeshes();
00099             /// @brief Sets the Ambient colour value of the material belonging to the specified submesh.
00100             /// @details The set value is applied to every technique of every pass in the material.
00101             /// @param Ambient The colour you wish to set as the material Ambient.
00102             /// @param Submesh The submesh you want to alter the material of.
00103             void SetMaterialAmbient(const ColourValue& Ambient, Whole Submesh = 0);
00104             /// @brief Sets the Specular colour value of the material belonging to the specified submesh.
00105             /// @details The set value is applied to every technique of every pass in the material.
00106             /// @param Specular The colour you wish to set as the material Specular.
00107             /// @param Submesh The submesh you want to alter the material of.
00108             void SetMaterialSpecular(const ColourValue& Specular, Whole Submesh = 0);
00109             /// @brief Sets the Diffuse colour value of the material belonging to the specified submesh.
00110             /// @details The set value is applied to every technique of every pass in the material.
00111             /// @param Diffuse The colour you wish to set as the material Diffuse.
00112             /// @param Submesh The submesh you want to alter the material of.
00113             void SetMaterialDiffuse(const ColourValue& Diffuse, Whole Submesh = 0);
00114     };
00115 }
00116 
00117 #endif
